author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: Those long passerelles would be an ideal target for on-shore defences, wait until they are fully loaded before hitting them with drones.

author: Rick Spilman
content:
I agree. The US tried but failed, but should try again. That prospect, however, seems unlikely with the current rogue administration.

https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/18/us-military-shuts-down-problematic-gaza-aid-pier-shifts-to-israeli-port

author: Chris Roche
content: It strikes me that a better use for this modern version of a Mulbery harbour would be to build it in Gaza where an effective international port is needed to manage proper supply of peaceful uninterupted humanitarian aid
